author: Special Correspondent
text:
Pattali Makkal Katchi (PMK) will contest all 234 constituencies by itself if an alliance does not materialise, the party’s chief ministerial candidate Anbumani Ramadoss said on Tuesday.

Loans

Taking part in a meeting of Vivasayigal Koottiyakkam chaired by its coordinator P.K. Deivasigamani here, Dr. Anbumani urged the farmers’ associations affiliated to the organisation to support PMK in the Assembly elections, with a promise of writing-off of agricultural loans extended by cooperative and nationalised banks.

PMK leader Ramadoss would take part in the Loan Waiver Convention to be organised by the Federation, he said.

The PMK, if voted to power, would allocate Rs. 50,000 crore for irrigational improvements, he said.

On the GAIL pipeline issue, Mr. Anbumani said the State Government had mishandled the situation.
title: ‘PMK will contest all seats if alliance not formed’
